column4: guys i think i did something silly and my task bar is gone from my desktop,  :(
you know the taskbar you get when you install ubuntu >.> _Michael
try Alt+F2; you should get a "Run application" dialog box.  Type 'gnome-panel' there and press enter.
try Alt+F2; you should get a "Run application" dialog box.  Type 'gnome-panel' there and press enter.
it says it detected a panel already running...
hrm.  ok, Alt+F2, type 'gnome-terminal' and press enter; should opne a terminal window
now run 'pkill gnome-terminal'  (on my system that immediately relaunches gnome-panel, for what it's worth)
it didnt work, i think ive done something really stupid >_>
what happens when you run 'pkill gnome-panel' ?
my buddy list appears from gaim lol :s
hrm.  I think i found a solution here https://answers.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/gnome-panel/+question/7759
need me to help you through it, or can you manage?
did the web page not do the necessary?
nope it just hangs when you input the first of the 3 commands it asks you to do :S

doh!  If you're up to it, you could try logging out, going to the text console (Ctl+Alt+F1), login there and run the gconftool-2 command given there; then Alt+F7 (to get back to login) and login as normal.
